talk.author: did:plc:edlwwxqwxftqssqyalatkuwx
talk.utter: "Primary challenges to incumbents are damaging" isn't even true! Weak incumbents inspire credible primary challenges, not the other way around.

talk.author: did:plc:fccnfzyczckkfawkonywsh3z
talk.utter: Right & contra OP, the rules for this primary are the same as they've always been (minus some more democratic reordering of the states) so what does it say about Biden that he hasn't inspired a credible challenge?

talk.author: did:plc:edlwwxqwxftqssqyalatkuwx
talk.utter:
This doesn't contradict Matt at all.

 Also, not a lot? Credible challenges are a sign of a weak candidate but not all weak candidates get a credible challenge? And if biden isn't weak what do you can what Matt is saying anyway?

talk.author: did:plc:edlwwxqwxftqssqyalatkuwx
talk.utter:
This doesn't contradict Matt at all.

 Also, not a lot? Credible challenges are a sign of a weak candidate but not all weak candidates get a credible challenge? And if biden isn't weak what do you can what Matt is saying anyway?

talk.author: did:plc:usgujwo5stxxyvwtib42pg6t
talk.utter: Isn’t Trump the only post-war incumbent to lose without having drawn a primary challenge?

talk.author: did:plc:edlwwxqwxftqssqyalatkuwx
talk.utter: Sure, but that's baseball fun facts. n=3 doesn't mean anything.

talk.author: did:plc:edlwwxqwxftqssqyalatkuwx
talk.utter: Sure, but that's baseball fun facts. n=3 doesn't mean anything.

talk.author: did:plc:usgujwo5stxxyvwtib42pg6t
talk.utter: We’re admittedly talking about a small sample size, but you’re making the claim that not all weak incumbents draw a primary challenger and we have exactly one case where that happened.

talk.author: did:plc:edlwwxqwxftqssqyalatkuwx
talk.utter: And exactly one where a weak incumbent did draw a credible primary challenge.
